API Privacy Addendum

Data protection addendum for the use of the Cryptospaces API.
Supplementary to the general Privacy Policy.

1. Purpose of This API Privacy Addendum

This API Privacy Addendum supplements the general Privacy Policy of Cryptospaces and applies specifically to users of the Cryptospaces API.

It governs data protection aspects related to automated and machine-based API usage.

2. Types of Data Processed

In the context of API usage, the following data may be processed:

  • Technical access data (IP address, timestamps)
  • API key and associated account
  • Request metadata (endpoints, volume, status codes)
  • Usage and abuse indicators

The API does not provide personal data about third parties.

3. Purpose of Processing

Data is processed solely for the following purposes:

  • Authentication and authorization
  • Security and system stability
  • Enforcement of rate limits and fair use
  • Abuse and fraud detection
  • Billing of API-related services

4. Legal Basis

Processing is based on:

  • Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR (performance of contract)
  • Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (legitimate interest in security and stability)

5. Storage & Deletion

API-related logs are:

  • Stored only as long as necessary,
  • Deleted or anonymized thereafter,
  • Removed at the latest after statutory retention periods.

6. Disclosure to Third Parties

API-related personal data is not shared, except:

  • With processors under Art. 28 GDPR,
  • Where legally required.

7. Security Measures

Cryptospaces implements appropriate technical and organizational measures, including:

  • API key authentication
  • Access controls
  • Security logging
  • Protection against unauthorized access

8. Responsibility for Downstream Processing

API users are solely responsible for:

  • Lawful use of API data,
  • Compliance within their own systems,
  • Informing their end users where applicable.

Cryptospaces assumes no responsibility for external data processing.

9. Provider & Contact

Cryptospaces

operated by:
